meanings.definition: The amount that can be held in one or both arms.
meanings.sent1: She carried an armsful of books to the library.
meanings.sent2: He struggled to hold the armsful of groceries.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to pick up an armsful of toys at once.
meanings.sent4: The hiker gathered an armsful of wildflowers along the trail.
meanings.sent5: The farmer harvested an armsful of ripe apples from the orchard.

meanings.definition: Enough to fill or be held by the arms.
meanings.sent1: She bought an armsful of colorful balloons for the party.
meanings.sent2: The tree was heavy with armsful of ripe fruit.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled an armsful of scarves out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The room was decorated with armsful of fairy lights.
meanings.sent5: The basket was overflowing with armsful of fresh vegetables from the garden.
